channel.title: 453 Private Server
channel.description:
Hi, I'm a real noob at this, having just got started, so forgive my inexperience. This is of course something everybody who is into client editing would know, so here is my question: I was looking around in my deobed client.java, and I came across this code: (this is just snippets used to assign strings and ints and such.)
this.getParameter("worldid") this.getParameter("modewhat") this.getParameter("modewhere") this.getParameter("lowmem") this.getParameter("members") this.getParameter("lang")
When I run java client I get this: Usage: worldid, [live/office/local], [live/rc/wip], [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], [english/german] So, I did this: java client 127 local wip lowmem free english And it runs. A Java window opens with the title Jagex, and tries to load RuneScape. When it gets to 'Connecting to Update Server' A message appears on the console that says 'error_game_js5connect' and it stops loading. Duh? I dunno if this is possible, but [live/office/local] implies that I can start a server locally on 127.0.0.1 that only I can play on? Please help me out on this, or just call me a noob if I don't have any idea what I'm talking about. But helping me out would doubtless be more useful. Thanks.

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:21, topic:70599”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=103719.msg1045794#msg1045794 date=1174777436]
Well, it’s already trying to connect to localhost, but if you wanted it to actually WORK with your server, you’d have to start from the ground up and figure out the new packet structres, and all the other things.
[/quote]
Figuring out the packet structures won’t be that hard at all. Search for a BigInteger in the client, and that’s the key to send to servers. The client’s private key is in the cache somewhere. VirtualMaster and I are already writing something just for that.[/quote]

We already yelled at you in the IRC but I’ll say it again: You have no idea.

Read full topic

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Well, it’s already trying to connect to localhost, but if you wanted it to actually WORK with your server, you’d have to start from the ground up and figure out the new packet structres, and all the other things.

Figuring out the packet structures won’t be that hard at all. Search for a BigInteger in the client, and that’s the key to send to servers. The client’s private key is in the cache somewhere. VirtualMaster and I are already writing something just for that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:18, topic:70599”]Thank you for that post, it helped me a lot!
To use this loader: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,97999.0.html
Do I copy the code, save compile, and just run? Or is there a specific place I need to put all the files for it work?[/quote]

I haven’t used it, but I’m pretty sure you just compile it and run. Everything probably needs to be in the same folder though.

Read full topic

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Unhandled:

OK thanks, for your help, I think I will try connecting to a real server and messing about, or will I just get banned right away?

There are a few traps that will detect you if you run the game as an application (especially a deobfuscated one). One of the earliest trap workarounds people started using was to run the client as an Applet within a JFrame, which prevents the client from sending the server a message saying that you’re running the game in a way no one is supposed to. This workaround is what a “loader” generally handles - look at pplsuqbawlz’s stuff, I gather it works pretty well.

Unhandled:

Just to clear this up, if I delete my UID.dat file, I won’t get banned instantly? Is there anything else I can do to prevent me from getting banned for as long as possible?

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:9, topic:70599”]By logging in, you’ll get banned.
By deleting your UID and changing your IP address, they won’t be able to connect it to any other account you may have.[/quote]

I agree that these are good measures, but honestly I’ve never gotten banned for just logging in on a deob with no further mods. I’ve definitely never had an otherwise clean account banned just for sharing UID or IP with a dirty one.

I logged in using an unmodded deob a few weeks ago with no mucking about with IP or UID; the account is still good. Granted I just walked around a bit, but I still consider it a successful test. I can’t remember whether the deob was renamed or not, so that might be it…

I think that they only care if you mess with stuff. Back in the #290s or maybe early #300s I removed the idle-logout timer. THAT got my ass banned in ten minutes, even with the significantly weaker detection they used then.

Read full topic

item.description:

Well, you should look at the stuff in the other client hacking sections, pplsuqbawlz’s loaders/bots are pretty top notch, go take a look at those and see if you can learn something.

Read full topic

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

You tell me I thought you were trying to make a server that can run with that client

Well, I realize my idiocy now, I thought by setting the [live/office/local] argument to local, it would start a 453 server on localhost which I could test stuff on. I am obviously wrong, as only Jagex staff would be able to start a server on localhost.
And if I don’t get banned right away, then its worth a try.
And for one last question, are there any good modified clients around? And if there are, how do I use them? I tried downloading one, but it compiled with 100+ errors.
Thanks for you help everyone!

Read full topic

By deleting your UID and changing your IP address, they won’t be able to connect it to any other account you may have.

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You’ll get banned instantly, so be sure to delete your UID, and if possible change your IP between logins.

Read full topic

item.title: 453 Private Server
item.dc:creator: @The_Cursed The Cursed
item.description:
@The_Cursed wrote:

Search : InetAddress.getLocalHost()
Change it into this : InetAddress.getByName(“po4.runescape.com”)

This will let it connect to the real RS servers

EDIT: oh crap, you meant how to let it connect to your server :o

i dont know, maybe change it to this? : InetAddress.getByName(“127.0.0.1”)
oh and dont forget to put the cache in the same folder of the client

Read full topic
